name: copilot-script-runner
description: AI-powered tool for running multi-line PowerShell and Bash scripts with GitHub Copilot. Solves the multi-line command issue with run_in_terminal by writing scripts to temp files before execution.

languageModelTools.name: script-runner_run_script
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Runs a PowerShell script by writing it to a temp file and executing it. This is ideal for multi-line commands that would fail with direct terminal execution. The script file is automatically cleaned up after execution. Returns stdout, stderr, and exit code. Supports background mode for long-running processes (servers, watch tasks) - set isBackground=true to return immediately with a terminal ID. Note: PowerShell is the RECOMMENDED choice for Windows environments.

script.description: The PowerShell script content to execute. Can be multi-line.

workingDirectory.description: The working directory to run the script in. Defaults to current directory.

keepScript.description: If true, keeps the temp script file after execution for debugging.

isBackground.description: If true, starts the script as a background process and returns immediately with a terminal ID. Use this for long-running processes like servers or watch tasks.

languageModelTools.name: script-runner_run_bash_script
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Runs a Bash script by writing it to a temp file and executing it via WSL or Git Bash. This is ideal for multi-line bash commands on Windows. The script file is automatically cleaned up after execution. Returns stdout, stderr, and exit code. Supports background mode for long-running processes - set isBackground=true to return immediately with a terminal ID. Note: Prefer 'run_script' (PowerShell) over this tool unless Bash is specifically required.

script.description: The Bash script content to execute. Can be multi-line.

workingDirectory.description: The working directory to run the script in. Defaults to current directory.

shell.description: Which shell to use. 'wsl' for Windows Subsystem for Linux, 'gitbash' for Git Bash.

keepScript.description: If true, keeps the temp script file after execution for debugging.

isBackground.description: If true, starts the script as a background process and returns immediately with a terminal ID. Use this for long-running processes like servers or watch tasks.
